{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3337923,"name":"","username":"ambiguouskangaroo","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/e19b73/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-03-20T02:31:16.589Z","cooked":"

Hello we use a sharp ir sensor to detect if the note is in our intake. Recently, during drive practice, it suddenly doesnt work and the sensor does not detect anymore. We have already tried using different wires and a replacement sensor but have not found any luck. What are some ideas to fix this?

Any help is appreciated as we have a competition in 2 days!

We use an IR Sharp sensor as well for the same use case.

Do you have it wired directly to the RoboRio?
Is the PWM cable flipped anywhere?
Are you able to see the raw sensor data through advantagescope?

If you already swapped out sensors, then you need to check the cable, as mentioned, and then try another port.

You already switch the wire/sensor so it not hardware related to the those. Can you check if you are actually getting power from whatever is powering these sensor? I would get voltmeter and measure the voltage to the sensor.
